intro: Vassobia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered vassobia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
